want to focus on the first one is descriptive analytics these these help us understand the past
of a device what happened you know descriptive descriptive
analytics are going to be dashboards visualizations trying to help us answer what would
happen in the past now we also have predictive analytics which is going to help us tell the future what's going to
happen how can we forecast what is going to happen based on current data or past
data and then third we have prescriptive analytics which define using the
combination of past present and future to ensure specific outcomes or recommended
outcomes so descriptive descriptive analytics you know as you see here it's going to be
looking at something like a dashboard where I see all of the data that has come in as being stored and
you know help me answer questions about what's what's what's been going on I also have predictive analytics examples
of this would be a you know a fault detection or fault prediction
fraud detection anomaly anomaly prediction and then prescriptive ER is

that that I really want you to come away with one is that there's this kind of a
pitfall of the term analytics and a lot of people think eh I want to build my
solution and then I'm going to put some kind of analytic solution on top of it and just measure it and and you
understand the health of that system help me make you know future future business decisions but really analytics
you want to start thinking about at the start of a business solution during every part of the development
cycle at the end and then start it all over again and you want to think about analytics as a data model which is a
question you're going to form a question what what do we want to learn about the system start with your questions up
front and then your solution you can start to work your analytics into that solution over time and then as you
deploy that solution or that iteration of that solution you can see if you've answered your question and so that's
that's kind of one one takeaways is always think about analytics at every stage and not just at the end to see if
you did something correctly or not or something as healthy or not because the the currency of IOT one of
the value propositions is to generate insights you know we can we can have these all these services and devices you
